intro: Choristea, commonly known as the water buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and aquatic or semi-aquatic habitat preferences. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and streams. Its leaves are usually floating or submerged, with a distinctive waxy coating that aids in water retention. Choristea species are known for their rapid growth and ability to thrive in nutrient-rich aquatic environments.
